title: Digitalising the experience at the Natural History Museum Aarhus
description: A museum app that combines essential info with immersive, interactive exhibition experiences.
problem: How can The Naturhistorisk Museum use digital solutions to attract and engage an 18+ audience in a meaningful and feasible way?
concept: We created a museum app that combines practical information with immersive, interactive exhibition experiences. Visitors can explore through AR and interactive maps in The Global Backyard, or step into a branching narrative in Expedition to Africa, where they become part of a historical journey brought to life through storytelling and digital enhancements.

process.title: Research
process.description: Finding out the most about our client and target group.

process.title: Ideation
process.description: Brainstorming and sketching ideas, and in the end picking the best one.

process.title: Development
process.description: Turning our prototype into a working, interactive solution.

title: Enhancing the experience at the Botnical Garden Aarhus
description: An interactive museum app that guides visitors through the garden with storytelling, featuring chatbots that bring the plants to life.
concept: An interactive botanical garden app that uses location-based notifications to bring plants to life through AI-driven conversations. Visitors can follow tailored storylines—whether on a date, with children, or exploring alone—making each visit a unique, playful, and personal experience.
problem: How might we transform a passive and repetitive garden visit into an engaging, interactive adventure that keeps visitors connected and entertained?

process.title: Research
process.description: Finding out the most about our client and target group.

process.title: Ideation
process.description: Brainstorming and sketching ideas, and in the end picking the best one.

process.title: Development
process.description: Turning our prototype into a working, interactive solution.
